Items: I am not afraid to voice my opinions, even when they are in opposition to others.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker was not afraid to voice their opinions, even when they were in opposition to others?

Items: For me, life has been a continuous process of learning, changing, and growth.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker was continuously in the process of learning, changing, and growing?

Items: In general, I feel I am in charge of the situation in which I live.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker felt in charge of the situation?

Items: People would describe me as a giving person, willing to share my time with others.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker would be described as a giving person, willing to share their time with others?

Items: I am not interested in activities that will expand my horizons.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker was not interested in expanding their horizons?

Items: I enjoy making plans for the future and working to make them a reality.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker enjoyed making plans for the future and working to make them a reality?

Items: Most people see me as loving and affectionate.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker was seen as loving and affectionate?

Items: In many ways I feel disappointed about my achievements in life.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker felt disappointed by their achievements in life?

Items: I live life one day at a time and don't really think about the future.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker lived one day at a time without much thought for the future?

Items: I tend to worry about what other people think of me.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker worried about what others thought of them?

Items: When I look at the story of my life, I am pleased with how things have turned out.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker felt pleased with how their life had turned out?

Items: I have difficulty arranging my life in a way that is satisfying to me.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker found it difficult to arrange their life in a satisfying way?

Items: My decisions are not usually influenced by what everyone else is doing.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker's decisions were not influenced by what everyone else was doing?

Items: I gave up trying to make big improvements or changes in my life a long time ago.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker had given up trying to make big improvements or changes in their life?

Items: The demands of everyday life often get me down.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the demands of everyday life affected the speaker negatively?

Items: I have not experienced many warm and trusting relationships with others.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker had not experienced many warm and trusting relationships with others?

Items: I think it is important to have new experiences that challenge how you think about yourself.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker valued new experiences that challenge their thoughts about themselves and the world?

Items: Maintaining close relationships has been difficult and frustrating for me.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker found it difficult and frustrating to maintain close relationships?

Items: My attitude about myself is probably not as positive as most people feel about themselves.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker's self-attitude was less positive than most people's?

Items: I have a sense of direction and purpose in life.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker felt a sense of direction and purpose?

Items: I judge myself by what I think is important, not by others' values.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker judged themselves by their own values rather than by others' values?

Items: In general, I feel confident and positive about myself.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker felt confident and positive about themselves?

Items: I have been able to build a living environment and a lifestyle for myself.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker had built a living environment and lifestyle they liked?

Items: I tend to be influenced by people with strong opinions.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker was influenced by people with strong opinions?

Items: I do not enjoy being in new situations that require me to change my ways.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker did not enjoy new situations that required change in familiar routines?

Items: I do not fit very well with the people and the community around me.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker felt they did not fit well with the people and community around them?

Items: I know that I can trust my friends, and they know they can trust me.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker felt mutual trust with their friends?

Items: When I think about it, I haven’t really improved much as a person over the years.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker felt they hadn't improved much as a person over the years?

Items: Some people wander aimlessly through life, but I am not one of them.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker felt they had direction in life, unlike those who wander aimlessly?

Items: I often feel lonely because I have few close friends with whom to share my concerns.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker felt lonely due to a lack of close friends for sharing concerns?

Items: When I compare myself to friends, it makes me feel good about who I am.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker felt good about themselves when comparing to friends and acquaintances?

Items: I don’t have a good sense of what it is I’m trying to accomplish in life.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker lacked a clear sense of what they were trying to accomplish in life?

Items: I sometimes feel as if I've done all there is to do in life.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker felt as if they had done all there is to do in life?

Items: I feel like many of the people I know have gotten more out of life than I have.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker felt others had gotten more out of life than they had?

Items: I have confidence in my opinions, even if contrary to the general consensus.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker had confidence in their opinions, even if contrary to the general consensus?

Items: I am quite good at managing the responsibilities of daily life.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker felt that they were good at managing the responsibilities of daily life?

Items: I have developed significantly as a person over time.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker felt they had developed significantly as a person over time?

Items: I enjoy personal and mutual conversations with family and friends.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker enjoyed personal and mutual conversations with family members and friends?

Items: My daily activities often seem trivial and unimportant to me.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker found their daily activities trivial and unimportant?

Items: I like most parts of my personality.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker liked most parts of their personality?

Items: It’s difficult for me to voice my opinions on controversial matters.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker found it difficult to voice their opinions on controversial matters?

Items: I often feel overwhelmed by my responsibilities.
Item-sit: How much does this experience indicate the speaker felt overwhelmed by their responsibilities?
